required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: To assess and improve the safety and success rate of vascular puncture and catheterization using ultrasound-guided methods.

detailed_description.textblock: Investigators hypothesized that （1） various ultrasound-guided methods had different performances of vascular puncture and catheterization, (2) certain risk factors influenced safety and success rate of vascular puncture and catheterization (3) implementation of protocols could improve the performances of ultrasound-guided vascular puncture and catheterization.

primary_outcome.measure: Successful rate without extra vascular damage
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year.
primary_outcome.description: Percentages of successful catheterization without vascular damage of posterior wall.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of successful catheterization at first attempt without needle withdraw.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year.
secondary_outcome.description: From beginning of needle puncture to finishing or failing catheterization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative factors of successful catheterization without posterior wall damage.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year.
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship between independent variables (gender, age, BMI, BP, depth and so on) and successful catheterization without posterior wall damage.

secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of depth to the successful catheterization without posterior wall puncture.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year.
secondary_outcome.description: The relationships between different depth of vascular anterior wall and successful catheterization without posterior wall puncture.

arm_group.description: Keep moving the probe for needle tip visualization during the puncture procedure.
Needle access along the hypotenuse of the regular triangle formed by the vascular depth and puncture point.

intervention.description: Use the according methods in dynamic arm descriptions.
Use the according methods in regular-triangle arm descriptions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age above 18 years old.
- Scheduled for selective surgery.
- Requirement of perioperative vascular puncture and catheterization.
- American standard of anesthesia level I-IV.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to vascular puncture or catheterization.
- Occlusion or thrombosis of target vessel evaluated by ultrasound.
- Refuse or disagreement from participants.

patient_data.ipd_description: Performances of vascular manufacture，such as posterior wall puncture，success at first attempt， overall success or failure and so on. Evaluations of vascular sonography， such as depth，diameter and so on.
